qas.question: What field did Muḥammad ibn Jābir al-Ḥarrānī al-Battānī contribute to?
What work is Muḥammad ibn Jābir al-Ḥarrānī al-Battānī known for as it regards to earth?

answers.text: improved the precision of the measurement of the precession of the Earth's axis

qas.question: What model did the work of Muslim World astronomers contribute to?
Who is said to have mastered the astrolabe?

plausible_answers.text: the measurement of the precession of the Earth's axis

qas.question: What model did Copernicas use to measure the earth's axis?
Who perfected the astrolabe originally developed by Islamic astronomers?
What model did Al-Biruni make corrections to?

context: In <a0_0>astronomy<a0_0/>, Muḥammad ibn Jābir al-Ḥarrānī al-Battānī <a1_0>improved the precision of <b5_0>the measurement of the precession of the Earth's axis<b5_0/><a1_0/>. The corrections made to <b8_0>the geocentric model<b8_0/> by al-Battani, Averroes, Nasir al-Din al-Tusi, Mu'ayyad al-Din al-'Urdi and Ibn al-Shatir were later incorporated into <a2_0>the <b6_0>Copernican heliocentric model<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Heliocentric theories were also discussed by several other Muslim astronomers such as Al-Biruni, Al-Sijzi, Qotb al-Din Shirazi, and Najm al-Dīn al-Qazwīnī al-Kātibī. The astrolabe, though originally developed by <a3_0>the <b7_0>Greeks<a3_0/>,<b7_0/> was perfected by <a4_0>Islamic astronomers and engineers<a4_0/>, and was subsequently brought to Europe.
